  3: /**
  4:  * This file is part of the "dibi" - smart database abstraction layer.
  5:  *
  6:  * Copyright (c) 2005 David Grudl (http://davidgrudl.com)
  7:  *
  8:  * For the full copyright and license information, please view
  9:  * the file license.txt that was distributed with this source code.
 10:  */
 11: 
 12: 
 13: /**
 14:  * DibiObject is the ultimate ancestor of all instantiable classes.
 15:  *
 16:  * DibiObject is copy of Nette\Object from Nette Framework (http://nette.org).
 17:  *
 18:  * It defines some handful methods and enhances object core of PHP:
 19:  *   - access to undeclared members throws exceptions
 20:  *   - support for conventional properties with getters and setters
 21:  *   - support for event raising functionality
 22:  *   - ability to add new methods to class (extension methods)
 23:  *
 24:  * Properties is a syntactic sugar which allows access public getter and setter
 25:  * methods as normal object variables. A property is defined by a getter method
 26:  * and optional setter method (no setter method means read-only property).
 27:  * <code>
 28:  * $val = $obj->label;     // equivalent to $val = $obj->getLabel();
 29:  * $obj->label = 'Nette';  // equivalent to $obj->setLabel('Nette');
 30:  * </code>
 31:  * Property names are case-sensitive, and they are written in the camelCaps
 32:  * or PascalCaps.
 33:  *
 34:  * Event functionality is provided by declaration of property named 'on{Something}'
 35:  * Multiple handlers are allowed.
 36:  * <code>
 37:  * public $onClick;                // declaration in class
 38:  * $this->onClick[] = 'callback';  // attaching event handler
 39:  * if (!empty($this->onClick)) ... // are there any handlers?
 40:  * $this->onClick($sender, $arg);  // raises the event with arguments
 41:  * </code>
 42:  *
 43:  * Adding method to class (i.e. to all instances) works similar to JavaScript
 44:  * prototype property. The syntax for adding a new method is:
 45:  * <code>
 46:  * MyClass::extensionMethod('newMethod', function(MyClass $obj, $arg, ...) { ... });
 47:  * $obj = new MyClass;
 48:  * $obj->newMethod($x);
 49:  * </code>
 50:  *
 51:  * @author     David Grudl
 52:  * @package    dibi
 53:  */
 54: abstract class DibiObject
 55: {
 56:     /** @var array (method => array(type => callback)) */
 57:     private static $extMethods;
 58: 
 59: 
 60:     /**
 61:      * Returns the name of the class of this object.
 62:      * @return string
 63:      */
 64:     final public /*static*/ function getClass()
 65:     {
 66:         return /*get_called_class()*/ /**/get_class($this)/**/;
 67:     }
 68: 
 69: 
 70:     /**
 71:      * Access to reflection.
 72:      * @return \ReflectionObject
 73:      */
 74:     final public function getReflection()
 75:     {
 76:         return new ReflectionObject($this);
 77:     }
 78: 
 79: 
 80:     /**
 81:      * Call to undefined method.
 82:      * @param  string  method name
 83:      * @param  array   arguments
 84:      * @return mixed
 85:      * @throws \LogicException
 86:      */
 87:     public function __call($name, $args)
 88:     {
 89:         $class = get_class($this);
 90: 
 91:         if ($name === '') {
 92:             throw new LogicException("Call to class '$class' method without name.");
 93:         }
 94: 
 95:         // event functionality
 96:         if (preg_match('#^on[A-Z]#', $name)) {
 97:             $rp = new ReflectionProperty($class, $name);
 98:             if ($rp->isPublic() && !$rp->isStatic()) {
 99:                 $list = $this->$name;
100:                 if (is_array($list) || $list instanceof Traversable) {
101:                     foreach ($list as $handler) {
102:                         /**/if (is_object($handler)) {
103:                             call_user_func_array(array($handler, '__invoke'), $args);
104: 
105:                         } else /**/{
106:                             call_user_func_array($handler, $args);
107:                         }
108:                     }
109:                 }
110:                 return NULL;
111:             }
112:         }
113: 
114:         // extension methods
115:         if ($cb = self::extensionMethod("$class::$name")) {
116:             array_unshift($args, $this);
117:             return call_user_func_array($cb, $args);
118:         }
119: 
120:         throw new LogicException("Call to undefined method $class::$name().");
121:     }
122: 
123: 
124:     /**
125:      * Call to undefined static method.
126:      * @param  string  method name (in lower case!)
127:      * @param  array   arguments
128:      * @return mixed
129:      * @throws \LogicException
130:      */
131:     public static function __callStatic($name, $args)
132:     {
133:         $class = get_called_class();
134:         throw new LogicException("Call to undefined static method $class::$name().");
135:     }
136: 
137: 
138:     /**
139:      * Adding method to class.
140:      * @param  string  method name
141:      * @param  mixed   callback or closure
142:      * @return mixed
143:      */
144:     public static function extensionMethod($name, $callback = NULL)
145:     {
146:         if (self::$extMethods === NULL || $name === NULL) { // for backwards compatibility
147:             $list = get_defined_functions();
148:             foreach ($list['user'] as $fce) {
149:                 $pair = explode('_prototype_', $fce);
150:                 if (count($pair) === 2) {
151:                     self::$extMethods[$pair[1]][$pair[0]] = $fce;
152:                     self::$extMethods[$pair[1]][''] = NULL;
153:                 }
154:             }
155:             if ($name === NULL) {
156:                 return NULL;
157:             }
158:         }
159: 
160:         $name = strtolower($name);
161:         $a = strrpos($name, ':'); // search ::
162:         if ($a === FALSE) {
163:             $class = strtolower(get_called_class());
164:             $l = & self::$extMethods[$name];
165:         } else {
166:             $class = substr($name, 0, $a - 1);
167:             $l = & self::$extMethods[substr($name, $a + 1)];
168:         }
169: 
170:         if ($callback !== NULL) { // works as setter
171:             $l[$class] = $callback;
172:             $l[''] = NULL;
173:             return NULL;
174:         }
175: 
176:         // works as getter
177:         if (empty($l)) {
178:             return FALSE;
179: 
180:         } elseif (isset($l[''][$class])) { // cached value
181:             return $l[''][$class];
182:         }
183:         $cl = $class;
184:         do {
185:             $cl = strtolower($cl);
186:             if (isset($l[$cl])) {
187:                 return $l[''][$class] = $l[$cl];
188:             }
189:         } while (($cl = get_parent_class($cl)) !== FALSE);
190: 
191:         foreach (class_implements($class) as $cl) {
192:             $cl = strtolower($cl);
193:             if (isset($l[$cl])) {
194:                 return $l[''][$class] = $l[$cl];
195:             }
196:         }
197:         return $l[''][$class] = FALSE;
198:     }
199: 
200: 
201:     /**
202:      * Returns property value. Do not call directly.
203:      * @param  string  property name
204:      * @return mixed   property value
205:      * @throws \LogicException if the property is not defined.
206:      */
207:     public function & __get($name)
208:     {
209:         $class = get_class($this);
210: 
211:         if ($name === '') {
212:             throw new LogicException("Cannot read a class '$class' property without name.");
213:         }
214: 
215:         // property getter support
216:         $name[0] = $name[0] & "\xDF"; // case-sensitive checking, capitalize first character
217:         $m = 'get' . $name;
218:         if (self::hasAccessor($class, $m)) {
219:             // ampersands:
220:             // - uses & __get() because declaration should be forward compatible (e.g. with Nette\Web\Html)
221:             // - doesn't call & $this->$m because user could bypass property setter by: $x = & $obj->property; $x = 'new value';
222:             $val = $this->$m();
223:             return $val;
224:         }
225: 
226:         $m = 'is' . $name;
227:         if (self::hasAccessor($class, $m)) {
228:             $val = $this->$m();
229:             return $val;
230:         }
231: 
232:         $name = func_get_arg(0);
233:         throw new LogicException("Cannot read an undeclared property $class::\$$name.");
234:     }
235: 
236: 
237:     /**
238:      * Sets value of a property. Do not call directly.
239:      * @param  string  property name
240:      * @param  mixed   property value
241:      * @return void
242:      * @throws \LogicException if the property is not defined or is read-only
243:      */
244:     public function __set($name, $value)
245:     {
246:         $class = get_class($this);
247: 
248:         if ($name === '') {
249:             throw new LogicException("Cannot assign to a class '$class' property without name.");
250:         }
251: 
252:         // property setter support
253:         $name[0] = $name[0] & "\xDF"; // case-sensitive checking, capitalize first character
254:         if (self::hasAccessor($class, 'get' . $name) || self::hasAccessor($class, 'is' . $name)) {
255:             $m = 'set' . $name;
256:             if (self::hasAccessor($class, $m)) {
257:                 $this->$m($value);
258:                 return;
259: 
260:             } else {
261:                 $name = func_get_arg(0);
262:                 throw new LogicException("Cannot assign to a read-only property $class::\$$name.");
263:             }
264:         }
265: 
266:         $name = func_get_arg(0);
267:         throw new LogicException("Cannot assign to an undeclared property $class::\$$name.");
268:     }
269: 
270: 
271:     /**
272:      * Is property defined?
273:      * @param  string  property name
274:      * @return bool
275:      */
276:     public function __isset($name)
277:     {
278:         $name[0] = $name[0] & "\xDF";
279:         return $name !== '' && self::hasAccessor(get_class($this), 'get' . $name);
280:     }
281: 
282: 
283:     /**
284:      * Access to undeclared property.
285:      * @param  string  property name
286:      * @return void
287:      * @throws \LogicException
288:      */
289:     public function __unset($name)
290:     {
291:         $class = get_class($this);
292:         throw new LogicException("Cannot unset the property $class::\$$name.");
293:     }
294: 
295: 
296:     /**
297:      * Has property an accessor?
298:      * @param  string  class name
299:      * @param  string  method name
300:      * @return bool
301:      */
302:     private static function hasAccessor($c, $m)
303:     {
304:         static $cache;
305:         if (!isset($cache[$c])) {
306:             // get_class_methods returns private, protected and public methods of Object (doesn't matter)
307:             // and ONLY PUBLIC methods of descendants (perfect!)
308:             // but returns static methods too (nothing doing...)
309:             // and is much faster than reflection
310:             // (works good since 5.0.4)
311:             $cache[$c] = array_flip(get_class_methods($c));
312:         }
313:         return isset($cache[$c][$m]);
314:     }
315: 
316: }
317:
